derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French alcôve, from Spanish alcoba, from Arabic al-kubba 'the vault'

entry.def: An alcove is a small area of a room which is formed by one part of a wall being built further back than the rest of the wall.

example.ex: In the alcoves on either side of the fire were bookshelves.
example.tran: 火炉两边的凹室里是书架。

means.word_mean: 1. a small recess opening off a larger room
